0.00.text: OK, so you are here to audition

1.72.text:
for a part in the British Airways
safety information video.

4.84.text:
Can you just look into the camera
and give your name please?

8.80.text:
And have you done
any safety videos before?

13.04.text:
Well, this could be your big break,
OK, mate? So don't mess it up.

16.52.text: Shall we get one in the can, guys?

19.28.text:
There's going to be an autocue
so you don't have to learn the lines.

30.24.text:
We will now demonstrate
the safety features on this aircraft

34.80.text:
as these may differ from any aircraft
that you've flown on before.

41.00.text:
Take care your hand baggage
does not block the aisles or exit.

43.92.text:
It must be put
under the seat in front of you

48.96.text: Place items in the locker carefully

50.76.text:
as they may fall out
and injure someone,

52.80.text:
especially if it's a bag
full of duty-free goods, darling.

56.60.text:
Actually, sorry.
That was meant for Joanna Lumley.

60.84.text: In the case of an evacuation,

62.28.text:
you must move quickly
to the closest, usable exit,

64.80.text:
taking absolutely nothing with you,
and I mean nothing, sweetie.

69.68.text:
Yeah, that was
another one of her lines.

78.52.text:
All exits are clearly marked
and are being pointed out to you now.

85.16.text:
Please take a moment
to locate your nearest exit,

87.96.text:
bearing in mind
this may be behind you.

93.96.text:
No, seriously, that bit about
the nearest exits, really powerful.

102.60.text:
Opening the doors automatically
inflates the evacuation slides.

107.04.text:
And remember,
high-heeled shoes must be taken off

109.68.text: as they may tear the slide.

111.72.text: God! No way! Designer shoes, like me.

120.68.text:
If the cabin air supply fails,
oxygen will be provided.

125.00.text:
Masks, like this,
will apear automatically.

128.32.text:
Stay in your seat
and pull the mask towards you.

131.48.text:
Place the mask over
your mouth and nose, like this,

133.72.text:
and breathe normally,
adjusting the band to secure it.

138.28.text:
Please note
that the bag may not inflate.

140.76.text:
In all the washrooms,
Club World and First cabins,

143.48.text:
you may need to pull on the coloured
streamer to release the mask.

147.00.text:
And please, please,
do make sure your own mask is fitted

154.00.text:
- Oh!
- You know, you'll get the part.

155.48.text: Do you think so? I hope so.

159.76.text:
Your life jacket
is underneath or beside your seat.

163.20.text:
If required, please remove the jacket
from its container

166.88.text: and pull it over your head.

169.88.text: Pass the tapes around your waist

172.64.text:
and tie them securely
in a double bow at the side.

179.16.text:
To inflate, pull the red toggle,
as shown.

182.60.text:
When you see a red toggle,
that's definitely the toggle to tug.

186.32.text:
Now, the air in this rather wonderful
jacket can be topped up

189.44.text:
by using this neat
little mouthpiece.

191.68.text:
There's also a charming whistle
and light combination

196.80.text:
should you be one of those people
who enjoys attention.

200.20.text:
And please, fairly obviously, do not
inflate your lovely life jacket

205.40.text:
until you've actually left the
aircraft,

209.88.text:
inflate away
and whistle all you like.

215.96.text: OK. So, Jim, I'll read the line

217.64.text:
and then when I do the nod,
you do the action.

221.44.text:
OK, please now ensure
that your seat is upright

224.20.text:
and in the take-off position,
with armrests down,

227.16.text:
your footstool and video screen
are stowed, if you have them,

230.60.text: and your table is folded away.

239.00.text: Is that it? Just the tray table?

241.40.text: That's it, and you smashed it.

244.88.text:
Well I suppose it does have a certain
je ne sais quoi.

250.76.text:
In the unlikely event of the aircraft
having to make an emergency landing,

255.08.text:
you will be told to adopt
this protective brace position.

260.84.text: If facing rearwards, in Club World,

266.92.text:
If you have any questions,
please ask your cabin crew.

270.36.text:
Great, very intense.
I love the soured face.

273.32.text:
Maybe we could try the next bit
just a little less serious?

278.48.text:
Just chill out mate,
really, you know.

279.52.text:
Maybe if you just move your head
actually, just...

281.84.text:
- No, no, it's fine.
- I've got it.

282.92.text:
You've got it? Yeah, just exactly,
so we can see the beautiful smile.

286.48.text:
But it's not X-Files.
There's no aliens about.

288.12.text:
- I got it.
- Just chill out, yeah?

293.44.text:
You'll also find the Flying Start
donation envelope in your seat area.

297.80.text:
So if you've got any spare change,
in any currency, find it,

302.12.text:
take it out and put it
in the envelope.

311.64.text:
On behalf of British Airways,
Comic Relief and Flying Start...

314.92.text:
..thank you for your attention
and your kind donations.

317.12.text:
Every penny of which will help
children all over the world...

321.48.text:
If you have any questions,
or you can't find your safety card...

325.76.text:
..please ask one
of your gorgeous cabin crew members.
